Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA sentence final particle that indicates the speaker’s request for confirmation or agreement from the hearer about some shared knowledge.English tag question (such as isn’t it?; is it?; don’t you?; do you?); you know', 'Example Sentences': [('坂本さんは煙草を吸わない・吸いませんね。', "Mr. Sakamoto doesn't smoke, does he? / Mr. Sakamoto, you don't \xa0smoke, do you?"), ('A:今日はいい天気ですね。      B:本当にそうですね。', "A: Today is a fine day, isn't it? \xa0 B: Isn't it!"), ('あなたは学生ですね。', "You are a student, aren't you?"), ('パーティーにいらっしゃいますね。', "You are going to the party, aren't you?")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicね.png'}

Meaning: A particle that indicates a point of time at which something takes place.At; in; on
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle that indicates a point of time at which something takes place.At; in; on', 'Example Sentences': [('私は毎朝六時半に起きる・起きます。', 'I get up at six thirty every morning.'), ('私は四月一日に生まれました。', 'I was born on April 1st.'), ('今朝は五時半にうちを出ました。', 'This morning I left home at five thirty.'), ('来年の夏（に）外国旅行をするつもりです。', 'I intend to make a trip abroad next summer.'), ('子供が学校に行っている間に手紙を書いた。', 'I wrote a letter while my children were away at school.'), ('田中は大学にいる時（に）今の奥さんと出会った。', 'Tanaka met his present wife when he was in college.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに.png'}

Meaning: An indirect object marker.To; for
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn indirect object marker.To; for', 'Example Sentences': [('私は母に手紙をよく書く・書きます。', 'I often write letters to my mother.'), ('父は僕に時計を呉れた。', 'My father gave me a watch.'), ('加藤先生はアメリカ人の学生に日本文学を教えている。', 'Professor Kato is teaching Japanese literature to American students.'), ('私は妹にお金を少しやりました。', 'I gave a little money to my younger sister.'), ('今井さんに電話しましたがいませんでした。', "I called Mr. Imai, but he wasn't there."), ('大川先生は学生に色々な辞書を見せた。', 'Professor Ookawa showed various dictionaries to his students.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに2.png'}

Meaning: A particle that indicates an agent or a source in passive, causative, もらう/てまらう and other receiving constructions.By; from
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle that indicates an agent or a source in passive, causative, もらう/てまらう and other receiving constructions.By; from', 'Example Sentences': [('一男は友達に手紙を読まれた・読まれました。', "Kazuo's friend read Kazuo's letter (and Kazuo was unhappy)."), ('秋子は浩にご飯を作らせた・作らせました。', 'Akiko made Hiroshi fix a meal.'), ('私は父に車を買ってもらった・もらいました。', 'My father bought me a car.'), ('ジェーンは山野先生に生け花を習った・習いました。', 'Jane took lessons in flower arranging from Mrs. Yamano.'), ('その子はお母さんに叱られました。', 'The child was scolded by its mother.'), ('A:そのネクタイは誰にもらったんですか。\u2003\u2003B:父にもらいました。', 'A: From whom did you receive that tie?\u2003\u2003B: I received it from my father.'), ('僕はアメリカ人に英語を教えてもらった。', 'I had an American teach me English.'), ('兄は私に五時間も運転させました。', 'My older brother made me drive for as long as five hours.'), ('A:吉田さんが結婚したそうですよ。\u2003\u2003B:そうですか。誰に聞きましたか。', 'A: I heard that Mr. Yoshida got married.\u2003\u2003B: Is that right? Who told you so?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに3.png'}

Meaning: A particle that indicates the surface of something upon which some action directly takes place.On; onto
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle that indicates the surface of something upon which some action directly takes place.On; onto', 'Example Sentences': [('子供は紙に絵を書いた・書きました。', 'A child has drawn a picture on the paper.'), ('ここにあなたの名前と住所を書いて下さい。', 'Please write your name and address here.'), ('ヘリコプターが山の上に降りました。', 'A helicopter landed on the top of the mountain.'), ('オーバーはハンガーに掛けて下さい。', 'Please hang your overcoat on the hanger.'), ('そんな所に立っていると危ないですよ。', "It's dangerous to keep standing in such a place.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに4.png'}

Meaning: A particle which indicates purpose when someone moves from one place to another.To do something; in order to do something
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which indicates purpose when someone moves from one place to another.To do something; in order to do something', 'Example Sentences': [('私はデパートへ贈り物を買いに行った・行きました。', 'I went to a department store to buy a gift'), ('学生が質問をしに来た。', 'A student came to ask questions.'), ('そこへ何をしに行くんですか。', 'To do what are you going there? / For what are you going there?'), ('村井さんは昼ご飯を食べにうちへ帰った。', 'Mr. Murai went home to eat his lunch.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに5.png'}

Meaning: A particle which indicates the location where someone or something exists.In; at; on
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which indicates the location where someone or something exists.In; at; on', 'Example Sentences': [('ヒルさんは今ジョンソンさんのアパートにいる・います。', "Mr. Hill is at Mr. Johnson's apartment now."), ('私のクラスには中国人の学生がいる・います。', 'There is a Chinese student in my class.'), ('その本はこの学校の図書館にあります。', "That book is in the school's library."), ('この学校にはプールがない。', 'There is no swimming pool at this school.'), ('加藤さんは大阪に住んでいます。', 'Mr. Kato lives in Osaka.'), ('庭に桜の木が立っている。', 'There is a cherry tree standing in the yard.'), ('この作文には文法の間違いが沢山見られる。', 'A lot of grammatical mistakes can be seen in this composition.'), ('花子はみのるの隣に座っている。', 'Hanako is sitting next to Minoru.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに6.png'}

Meaning: A particle which indicates a place toward which someone or something moves.To; toward.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which indicates a place toward which someone or something moves.To; toward.', 'Example Sentences': [('私はきのうサンフランシスコに行った・行きました。', 'I went to San Francisco yesterday.'), ('ジムは来年アメリカに帰る。', 'Jim is going back to America next year.'), ('いつか私のうちに来ませんか。', "Wouldn't you like to come to my house sometime?"), ('彼らは角のレストランに入った。', 'They entered the restaurant around the corner.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに7.png'}

Word: に違いない・にちがいない
Meaning: The speaker is convinced that there is no mistake on his part in guessing something.There is no doubt that ~; must be ~; no doubt
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesThe speaker is convinced that there is no mistake on his part in guessing something.There is no doubt that ~; must be ~; no doubt', 'Example Sentences': [('下田さんは今日のことを忘れたに違いない・違いありません。', 'Mr. Shimoda must have forgotten today’s plans.'), ('あの先生の試験は難しいに違いない・違いません。', "That teacher's exams must be hard."), ('ベイリーさんはテニスが上手に違いない・違いありません。', 'Mr. Bailey must be good at tennis.'), ('あの人は日本人に違いない・違いありません。', 'That person must be Japanese.'), ('二人は今頃ハワイで楽しく泳いでいるに違いない。', 'The two must be enjoying swimming in Hawaii.'), ('一人で外国へ行くのは大変に違いない。', 'It must be hard to go to a foreign country alone.'), ('山口さんは頭がいいに違いない。', 'Mr. Yamaguchi must be bright.'), ('あれはトンプソンさんに違いない。', 'That must be Mr. Thompson.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicに違いない.png'}

Meaning: Something or someone is hard to ~.Hard to ~; difficult to ~; don’t do something easily; not readily; not prone to ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomething or someone is hard to ~.Hard to ~; difficult to ~; don’t do something easily; not readily; not prone to ~', 'Example Sentences': [('この本は大変読みにくい・にくいです。', 'This book is very hard to read.'), ('このドアは開きにくいですね。', "This door doesn't open easily, does it?"), ('あの人の名前は覚えにくい。', 'His name is hard to remember.'), ('あの先生は話しにくいです。', 'That teacher is hard to talk to.'), ('この靴は走りにくいです。', 'These shoes are hard to run in.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicにくい.png'}

Meaning: A phrase that indicates a generally agreed upon standard (the entire sentence that includes this phrase expresses some deviation from that standard.)For ~; considering that ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase that indicates a generally agreed upon standard (the entire sentence that includes this phrase expresses some deviation from that standard.)For ~; considering that ~', 'Example Sentences': [('高山さんは日本人にしては大きい・大きいです。', 'Mr. Takayama is big for a Japanese person.'), ('ボブは日本語をよく勉強しているにしては下手だ・下手です。', 'Considering that Bob is studying Japanese hard, he is poor at it.'), ('八月にしては涼しいですね。', "For August is it cool, isn't it?"), ('これは日本の車にしては大きいですね。', "For a Japanese car this is big, isn't it?"), ('彼はレスラーだったにしては体が小さい。', 'Considering that he was a wrestler, he is small.'), ('青木さんはアメリカに十年いたにしては英語があまり上手じゃない。', 'Considering that Mr. Aoki spent ten years in America, his English is not very good.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicにしては.png'}

Meaning: Someone has decided on something.Decide on ~; make it ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone has decided on something.Decide on ~; make it ~', 'Example Sentences': [('私はこのアパートにする・します。', "I've decided on this apartment."), ('A:あなたは何にしますか。\u2003\u2003B:私はステーキにします。', "A: What have you decided on?\u2003\u2003B: I've decided on steak."), ('岡田さんはアメリカの車にしました。', 'Mr. Okada (has) decided on an American car.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicにする.png'}

Meaning: A particle which, with a preceding noun phrase, forms a phrase to modify a following noun phrase.‘s; of; in; at; for; by; from
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which, with a preceding noun phrase, forms a phrase to modify a following noun phrase.‘s; of; in; at; for; by; from', 'Example Sentences': [('これは先生の本だ・です。', "This is my teacher's book."), ('これは友達からの手紙だ・です。', 'This is a letter from my friend.'), ('私の本\u2003\u2003学校の名前\u2003\u2003今日の新聞', "my book\u2003\u2003the name of the school\u2003\u2003today's paper"), ('日本の寺\u2003\u2003駅の電話', 'a temple in Japan\u2003\u2003a telephone at the station'), ('美術の本\u2003\u2003日本語の試験', 'a book on fine arts\u2003\u2003an exam on Japanese'), ('桜の花\u2003\u2003桃の木\u2003\u2003バスの切符\u2003\u2003風邪の薬', 'a cherry blossom\u2003\u2003a peach tree\u2003\u2003a bus ticket\u2003\u2003cold medicine'), ('日本語の先生\u2003\u2003音楽の学生', 'a teacher of Japanese\u2003\u2003a student of music'), ('友達の大木さん\u2003\u2003医者の森田さん\u2003\u2003カラーの写真\u2003\u2003十歳の子供', 'my friend Mr. Ooki\u2003\u2003a medical doctor, Dr. Morita\u2003\u2003a photo in colour\u2003\u2003a ten year old child'), ('絹のドレス\u2003\u2003れんがの家', 'a silk dress\u2003\u2003a brick house'), ('八時からのパーティー\u2003\u2003先生との話し合い', 'a party which starts at eight o’clock\u2003\u2003a discussion with the teacher')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicの.png'}

Meaning: A dependent indefinite pronoun.One
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA dependent indefinite pronoun.One', 'Example Sentences': [('私は大きいのを買った・買いました。', 'I bought a big one.'), ('私は去年買ったのを使った・使いました。', 'I used the one I bought last year.'), ('A:どんな車が欲しいですか。\u2003\u2003B:小さいのが欲しいです。', 'A: What kind of car do you want?\u2003\u2003B: I want a small one.'), ('友達がワインを飲みたがったので昨日買ったのを出した。', 'My friend wanted to drink wine, so I served the one I bought yesterday.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicの2.png'}

Meaning: A nominaliser which is used when the nominalised sentence expresses a directly perceptible event.That ~; to do something; doing something
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA nominaliser which is used when the nominalised sentence expresses a directly perceptible event.That ~; to do something; doing something', 'Example Sentences': [('日本語を教えるのは難しい・難しいです。', 'Teaching Japanese is difficult.'), ('私は雪子さんがビールを飲むのを見た・見ました。', 'I saw Yukiko drink beer.'), ('日本へ行くのは簡単です。', 'Going to Japan is easy.'), ('私は小林さんがピアノを弾いているのを聞いた。', 'I heard Ms. Kobayashi playing the piano.'), ('クラークさんがフランスへ行くのを知っていますか。', 'Do you know that Mr. Clark is going to France?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicの3.png'}

Meaning: A sentence-final particle used by a female or a child to indicate an explanation or emotive emphasis.It is that ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA sentence-final particle used by a female or a child to indicate an explanation or emotive emphasis.It is that ~', 'Example Sentences': [('A:どうして泣いているの？\u2003\u2003B:お母さんがいないの。', "A: How come you are crying?\u2003\u2003B: 'Cause mommy's gone."), ('あの人はとても優しいの。', 'He is so gentle, you know.'), ('母はまだとても元気なの。', 'My mother is still quite fine.'), ('主人はエンジニアなの。', 'My husband is an engineer.'), ('A:どうして食べないの？\u2003\u2003B:お腹（が）空いて（い）ないの。', "A: How come you don't eat it?\u2003\u2003B: 'Cause I'm not hungry."), ('A:どうしたの？\u2003\u2003B:頭が痛いの。', "A: What's the matter with you?\u2003\u2003B: I have a headache."), ('うちの子はまだ小学生なの。', 'My child is still in grade school.'), ('大学はプリンストンだったの。', 'My university was Princeton.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicの4.png'}

Meaning: A sentence ending which indicates that the speaker is explaining or asking for an explanation about some information shared with the hearer, or is talking about something emotively, as if it were of common interest to the speaker and the hearer.The explanation is that ~; The reason is that ~; The fact is that ~; It is that ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA sentence ending which indicates that the speaker is explaining or asking for an explanation about some information shared with the hearer, or is talking about something emotively, as if it were of common interest to the speaker and the hearer.The explanation is that ~; The reason is that ~; The fact is that ~; It is that ~', 'Example Sentences': [('何をしているん・のですか。', 'What are you doing?'), ('日本語を勉強しているん・のです。', "I'm studying Japanese."), ('A:どうしてお酒を飲まないんですか。\u2003\u2003B:私はまだ十七なんです。', "A: Why don't you drink sake?\u2003\u2003B: (The reason is that) I'm still seventeen."), ('僕は今日のパーティーに行けません。宿題が沢山あるんです。', "I can't go to today's party. I have a lot of homework."), ('あなたと結婚したいんです。', 'I want to marry you.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicのだ.png'}

Meaning: A subordinate conjunction which expresses a reason or a cause.So; since; because
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA subordinate conjunction which expresses a reason or a cause.So; since; because', 'Example Sentences': [('お酒を沢山飲んだので眠くなった・なりました。', 'Because I drank a lot of sake, I got sleepy.'), ('宿題が沢山あるのでパーティー行けません。', "Since I have a lot of homework, I can't go to the party."), ('その本は高かったので買わなかった。', "Because that book was expensive, I didn't buy one."), ('私の部屋は静かなのでよく勉強出来ます。', 'My room is quiet, so I can study (there) well.'), ('ジェーンはまだ中学生なので車を運転出来ない。', "Because Jane is still a junior high school student, she can't drive a car.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicので.png'}

Meaning: Contrary to everybody’s expectation based on the sentence preceding のに, the proposition in the sentence following のに is the case.Even though; despite the fact that ~; although; but; in spite of the fact that ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesContrary to everybody’s expectation based on the sentence preceding のに, the proposition in the sentence following のに is the case.Even though; despite the fact that ~; although; but; in spite of the fact that ~', 'Example Sentences': [('毎日漢字を勉強しているのによく覚えられない・覚えられません。', "Although I'm studying kanji every day, I cannot memorize them well."), ('このステーキは高いのに美味しくない・美味しくありません。', "In spite of the fact that this steak is expensive, it isn't delicious."), ('清水さんはゴルフが下手なのに大好きだ・大好きです。', 'Although Mr. Shimizu is not good at golf, he loves it.'), ('ホールさんはアメリカ人なのに肉が嫌いだ・嫌いです。', "In spite of the fact that Mr. Hall is an American, he doesn't like meat."), ('中学と高校で六年間も英語を勉強したのにまだ英語が話せません。', 'I studied English for as many as six years at junior high and senior high, but I still cannot speak it.'), ('寒いのにオーバーを着ないで出かけた。', 'Although it was cold, he went out without wearing an overcoat.'), ('あの人はピアノが上手なのにめったに弾きません。', 'He is good at piano, but seldom plays.'), ('父は九十歳なのにまだ働いています。', 'My father is still working in spite of the fact that he is ninety years old.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicのに.png'}

Meaning: In the process or for the purpose of doing something expressed in the の nominalised clause.In the process of doing ~; (in order) to do ~; for the purpose of ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesIn the process or for the purpose of doing something expressed in the の nominalised clause.In the process of doing ~; (in order) to do ~; for the purpose of ~', 'Example Sentences': [('私は日本語の新聞を読むのに辞書を使う・使います。', 'I used a dictionary to read Japanese newspapers.'), ('すき焼きを作るのには何が要りますか。', 'What do you need to make sukiyaki?'), ('このレポートを書くのに一ヶ月かかりました。', 'It took me a month to write this paper.'), ('会社に行くのにバスと電車を使っている。', 'I am using the bus and the train to get to my company.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicのに2.png'}

Meaning: A structure that indicates new, important information by placing it between のは and the copula だ (の is an indefinite pronoun (の2) that replaces ‘time’,’person’, ‘thing’, ‘place’ or ‘reason’.)It is ~ that ~; the one who ~ is ~; the place where ~ is ~; the reason why ~ is ~; the time when ~ is ~; what ~ is ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA structure that indicates new, important information by placing it between のは and the copula だ (の is an indefinite pronoun (の2) that replaces ‘time’,’person’, ‘thing’, ‘place’ or ‘reason’.)It is ~ that ~; the one who ~ is ~; the place where ~ is ~; the reason why ~ is ~; the time when ~ is ~; what ~ is ~', 'Example Sentences': [('私が中国に行ったのは三年前だ・です。', 'It was three years ago that I went to China. / The time when I went to China was three years ago.'), ('このクラスで一番頭がいいのは吉田さんだ・です。', 'The brightest one in this class is Mr. Yoshida.'), ('ここで一番奇麗なのは山だ・です。', 'The most beautiful things here are mountains.'), ('山田さん、あなたがシカゴに行ったのはいつですか。', 'Mr. Yamada, when was it that you went to Chicago?'), ('一昨日遊びに来たのは秋子さんです。', 'It was Akiko who came to see me the day before yesterday.'), ('モーツアルトが大好きになったのは大学一年の時です。', 'It was during my freshman year that I become very fond of Mozart.'), ('父が嫌いなのはテレビだ。', 'It is television that my father hates.'), ('日本で美味しいのは果物だ。', 'What is delicious in Japan is fruit.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicのは～だ.png'}

Meaning: A prefix that expresses politeness.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA prefix that expresses politeness.', 'Example Sentences': [('石田先生は英語でお話しになった・なりました。', 'Professor Ishida talked in English.'), ('私は昨日山崎先生にお会いした・しました。', 'I met Professor Yamazaki yesterday.'), ('今村さんはゴルフがお好きだ・好きです。', 'Mr. Imamura likes golf.'), ('お飲み物は何が宜しいですか。', 'As for drinks, what would be good?'), ('田村先生は今とてもお忙しい。', 'Professor Tamura is very busy now.'), ('毎日お暑いですね。', "It's hot day after day, isn't it?"), ('上田先生はテニスがお上手です。', 'Professor Ueda is good at tennis.'), ('宮本さんの奥様はとてもお奇麗だ。', 'Mrs. Miyamoto is very pretty.'), ('野村さんからお電話がありました。', 'There was a phone call from Mr. Nomura.'), ('お昼ご飯はもう食べましたか。', 'Have you had your lunch yet?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicお.png'}

Meaning: A particle which marks a direct object.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which marks a direct object.', 'Example Sentences': [('私は日本語を勉強している・います。', "I'm studying Japanese."), ('前田さんは昨日車を買った。', 'Mr. Maeda bought a car yesterday.'), ('何を飲みますか。', 'What will you drink?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicを.png'}

Meaning: A particle which indicates a space in/on/across/through/along which someone or something moves.In; on; across; through; along; over
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which indicates a space in/on/across/through/along which someone or something moves.In; on; across; through; along; over', 'Example Sentences': [('私は五番街を歩いた・歩きました。', 'I walked along Fifth Avenue.'), ('公園を通って帰りましょう。', "Let's go home passing through the park."), ('鶴が湖の上を飛んでいます。', 'Cranes are flying over the lake.'), ('日本では車は道の左側を走ります。', 'In Japan they drive on the left side of the street.'), ('そこの交差点を右に曲がって下さい。', 'Please turn to the right at the intersection there.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicを2.png'}

Meaning: A particle that marks the location from which some movement begins.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle that marks the location from which some movement begins.', 'Example Sentences': [('私は朝七時半に家を出る・出ます。', 'I leave home at 7.30 in the morning.'), ('汽車がトンネルを出た。', 'A train came out of the tunnel.'), ('バスを降りた時友達に会った。', 'I met a friend when I got off the bus.'), ('日本を離れて外国で暮らしている。', 'He left Japan and is living abroad.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicを3.png'}

Meaning: A particle that marks the cause of some human emotion.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle that marks the cause of some human emotion.', 'Example Sentences': [('次郎は父の死を悲しんだ・悲しみました。', "Jiro was saddened at his father's death."), ('次郎は父が死んだこと・のを悲しんだ・悲しみした。', 'Jiro was sad that his father died.'), ('私は浩の大学入学を喜んだ。', "I was happy about Hiroshi's entering college."), ('ヨーロッパ人はまだ戦争が起きることを恐れている。', 'Europeans are afraid that war will break out again.'), ('信子は京都での一年を懐かしんだ。', 'Nobuko nostalgically recollected her year in Kyoto.'), ('林は英語が出来ないことを悩んでいる。', 'Hayashi is worried that he cannot speak English.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicを4.png'}

Meaning: (of quantity or number) a lotMany; a lot of; much
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentences(of quantity or number) a lotMany; a lot of; much', 'Example Sentences': [('日本（に）は大学が多い・多いです。', 'In Japan universities are many.'), ('京都（に）はお寺が多いです。', 'There are many temples in Kyoto.'), ('ロスさんの作文（に）は間違いが多いです。', "There are many mistakes in Mr. Ross's compositions."), ('一月（に）は雪が多い。', 'There is a lot of snow in January.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic多い.png'}

Meaning: Do something in advance for future convenience.Do something in advance; go ahead and do something; let someone/something remain as he/it is
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesDo something in advance for future convenience.Do something in advance; go ahead and do something; let someone/something remain as he/it is', 'Example Sentences': [('明日パーティーをするのでビールを買っておいた・おきました。', 'Since we are having a party tomorrow, I bought some beer for it.'), ('今日は昼に客が来るので昼ご飯を早目に食べておいた。', "Since I'm having a guest at noon today, I had my lunch earlier."), ('来年日本へ行くから少し日本語を勉強しておきます。', "Since I'm going to Japan next year, I will study a little Japanese ahead of time.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicおく.png'}

Meaning: A phrase which expresses the speaker’s respect for someone when describing that person’s action or state
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase which expresses the speaker’s respect for someone when describing that person’s action or state', 'Example Sentences': [('田中先生はもうお帰りになった・なりました。', 'Professor Tanaka already went home.'), ('この本をもうお読みになりましたか。', 'Have you read this book yet?'), ('グッドマン先生は私の名前をお忘れになった。', 'Professor Goodman has forgotten my name.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicお～になる.png'}

Meaning: A phrase which humbly expresses the speaker’s politeness to someone when describing the speaker’s action or state that involves or affects that person.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase which humbly expresses the speaker’s politeness to someone when describing the speaker’s action or state that involves or affects that person.', 'Example Sentences': [('私は先生のスーツケースをお持ちした・しました。', "I carried my teacher's suitcase."), ('そのことは私がお話ししましょう。', 'I will tell you about that matter.'), ('山村君は先生に本をお借りした。', 'Mr. Yamamura borrowed a book from his teacher.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicお～する.png'}

Meaning: Finish doing ~Finish; end
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesFinish doing ~Finish; end', 'Example Sentences': [('源氏物語をやっと読み終わった・終わりました。', 'I finally finished reading The Tale of Genji.'), ('やっと論文を書き終わった。', 'I finally finished writing a paper.'), ('ちょうどご飯を食べ終わったところです。', "I've just finished eating my meal.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic終わる.png'}

Meaning: A state or an action cannot be controlled by someone or something.Be –ed; get –ed
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA state or an action cannot be controlled by someone or something.Be –ed; get –ed', 'Example Sentences': [('一郎は花子に騙された・騙されました。', 'Ichiro was deceived by Hanako.'), ('ジェーンはフレッドに夜遅くアパートに来られた・来られました。', "Fred came to Jane's apartment late at night (and Jane was unhappy)."), ('私は弟にケーキを食べられた・食べられました。', 'I got my cake eaten by my younger brother. / My younger brother ate my cake (and I was unhappy).'), ('田中先生は日本へ帰られた・帰られました。', 'Professor Tanaka went back to Japan (honorific).'), ('このビルは二年前に建てられた。', 'This building was built two years ago.'), ('この本は１９６５年にアメリカで出版された。', 'This book was published in America in 1965.'), ('私は二年前妻に死なれた。', 'My wife died two years ago (and gave me sorrow).'), ('原田さんは奥さんに高いコートを買われた。', "Mr. Harada's wife bought an expensive coat (and he is unhappy)."), ('林先生は日本の大学のことを話された。', 'Professor Hayashi talked about Japanese universities (honorific).')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicられる.png'}

Meaning: An auxiliary verb which indicates potential.Be able to do something; can do something; be –able; ~ can be done
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn auxiliary verb which indicates potential.Be able to do something; can do something; be –able; ~ can be done', 'Example Sentences': [('私は日本語が読める・読めます。', 'I can read Japanese.'), ('この水は飲めない・飲めません。', 'This water is not drinkable.'), ('ブラウンさんは刺身が食べられる。', 'Mr. Brown can eat sashimi.'), ('寺田さんはテニスが出来る。', 'Mr. Terada can play tennis.'), ('この字は読めない。', 'This letter is not readable.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicられる2.png'}

Meaning: An auxiliary adjective which indicates that the preceding sentence is the speaker’s conjecture based on what he has heard, read or seen.Seem; look like; apparently; I heard
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn auxiliary adjective which indicates that the preceding sentence is the speaker’s conjecture based on what he has heard, read or seen.Seem; look like; apparently; I heard', 'Example Sentences': [('松田さんはアメリカへ行くらしい・らしいです。', 'It seems that Mr. Matsuda is going to America.'), ('杉本さんはもう帰ったらしいです。', 'Mr. Sugimoto seems to have gone home already.'), ('あの学校の入学試験は難しいらしい。', "That school's entrance exam seems difficult."), ('この辺りはとても静からしいです。', 'This neighbourhood seems very quiet.'), ('その話は本当らしい。', 'That story seems true.'), ('ここは学校らしい。', 'This place seems to be a school.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicらしい.png'}

{'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentences', 'Example Sentences': [('［田中さんが食べた］ステーキは高かった・高かったです。', 'The steak that Mr. Tanaka ate was expensive.'), ('［ステーキが美味しい］レストランを知らない・知りませんか。', 'Do you know a restaurant which has good steak (literally: in which steak is good)?'), ('［日本語を教えている］先生は小林先生です。', 'The teacher who is teaching Japanese is Professor Kobayashi.'), ('［テニスが上手］な人を教えて下さい。', 'Please tell me of a person who is good at tennis.'), ('［お父さんが医者］の学生は三人います。', 'There are three students whose fathers are doctors.'), ('［私がいた］町は病院がなかった。', 'There was no hospital in the town where I lived.'), ('［道子が行く］学校は東京にあります。', 'The school where Michiko is going is in Tokyo.'), ('［スティーブがあなたの写真を撮った］カメラはこれですか。', 'Is this the camera with which Steve took pictures of you?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/BasicRelative Clause.png'}

Meaning: A suffix that makes a noun out of an adjective by attaching it to the stem of an Adj (い) or much less frequently to the stem of an Adj (な)-ness; -ly
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA suffix that makes a noun out of an adjective by attaching it to the stem of an Adj (い) or much less frequently to the stem of an Adj (な)-ness; -ly', 'Example Sentences': [('このうちの広さはちょうどいい・いいです。', 'This size of this house is just right.'), ('富士山の高さはどのぐらいですか。', 'What is the approximate height of Mt. Fuji?'), ('日本語の難しさがよく分かりました。', "I'm now well aware of the difficulty of Japanese."), ('アメリカのよさはパイオニア・スピリットでしょう。', "One of America's good qualities is perhaps its pioneering spirit.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicさ.png'}

Meaning: A suffix (originally meaning 'appearance') that indicates the speaker's/writer's politeness towards someone.Mr; Miss; Ms; Mrs
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': "Spoiler English example sentencesA suffix (originally meaning 'appearance') that indicates the speaker's/writer's politeness towards someone.Mr; Miss; Ms; Mrs", 'Example Sentences': [('王様の耳は驢馬の耳だ。', "The King's ears are donkey ears."), ('神様を信じますか。', 'Do you believe in God?'), ('花子ちゃん、今夜はお月様もお星様も奇麗ねえ。', "Hanako, aren't the moon and the stars beautiful tonight!"), ('お母様、どこにいらっしゃるの？', 'Mother, where are you going?'), ('お客様が見えたよ。', 'Our guests have come.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic様.png'}

Meaning: Cause someone/something to do something or cause something to change its state.Make someone/something do something; cause someone/something to do something; let someone/something do something; allow someone/something to do something; have someone/something do something; get someone/something to do something.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesCause someone/something to do something or cause something to change its state.Make someone/something do something; cause someone/something to do something; let someone/something do something; allow someone/something to do something; have someone/something do something; get someone/something to do something.', 'Example Sentences': [('鈴木さんは娘を・に大学へ行かせた・行かせました。', 'Mr. Suzuki made/let his daughter go to college.'), ('父は妹にピアノを習わせた・習わせました。', 'My father made (or let) my younger sister learn to play the piano.'), ('久子は私を困らせた。', 'Hisako made me have trouble. / Hisako caused me trouble.'), ('このゲームはジムに勝たせようと思う。', "I think I'll let Jim win this game."), ('友達は私にチップを払わせた。', 'My friend made me leave (lit pay) a tip.'), ('アンダーソンさんは子供達に好きなだけアイスクリームを食べさせた。', 'Mr. Anderson let his children eat as much ice cream as they liked.'), ('私は冷蔵庫でミルクを凍らせた。', 'I made milk freeze (I froze milk) in the refrigerator.'), ('それは私にさせてください。', 'As for that, let me do it.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicさせる.png'}

Meaning: Some situation which seldom occurs has now occurred and one can either make use of it or, to one’s regret, cannot make use of it.With effort; at great pain; take the trouble to do ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSome situation which seldom occurs has now occurred and one can either make use of it or, to one’s regret, cannot make use of it.With effort; at great pain; take the trouble to do ~', 'Example Sentences': [('せっかく会いに行ったのに友達はいなかった・いませんでした。', "I took the trouble to go see my friend, but he wasn't at home."), ('せっかくいい大学に入ったのだからよく勉強するつもりだ・です。', 'I entered a good college with great effort, so I intend to study hard.'), ('せっかくの日曜日なのに働いた・働きました。', 'Although Sunday is precious (to me), I worked (all day long).'), ('せっかくアメリカまで行ったのにニューヨークに行けなくて残念だった。', "I went as far as America at great expense, but, to my regret, I couldn't make it to New York."), ('せっかく日本語を三年間も勉強したのだから、是非一度日本へ行ってみたいと思います。', 'Because I studied Japanese for (as many as) three years, I would love to go to Japan once.'), ('せっかくの旅行が病気で駄目になりました。', 'My long awaited trip had to be canceled because of my illness.'), ('せっかくですが今日は忙しくて行けません。', "I appreciate your most kind offer, but I'm too busy to go there today."), ('せっかくのチャンスだからデートしたらどうですか。', "It's a good chance, so why don't you date her?"), ('せっかくですから遠慮なくいただきます。', 'Since you took the trouble to bring it to me, I’ll take it without hesitation.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicせっかく.png'}

Meaning: A conjunction to indicate ‘and’ in an emphatic way.And what’s more; not only ~ but also ~; so
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA conjunction to indicate ‘and’ in an emphatic way.And what’s more; not only ~ but also ~; so', 'Example Sentences': [('今日はテニスもしたし、映画も見た・見ました。', 'I not only played tennis but also saw a movie today.'), ('ここは夏は暑いし、冬は寒い・寒いです。', "Here it's hot in the summer, and what's more, it's cold in the winter."), ('このアパートは奇麗だし、安い・安いです。', "This apartment is clean, and what's more, it's inexpensive."), ('遊びたいんです・だが明日は試験だし遊べない・遊べません。', "I would like to play, but there is an exam tomorrow, and I can't fool around."), ('仕事もあったし、結婚も出来たし、とても嬉しいです。', "Not only did I find a job, but I was also able to get married, so I'm very happy."), ('今日は天気もいいし、どこへ行きましょうか。', "It's a nice day, so shall we go out somewhere?"), ('あの人は美人だし、頭もいい。', "She's beautiful and what's more she's bright."), ('切符は買ってあるし、是非見に行きましょう。', "I've bought a ticket for you, so let's go see it, by all means.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicし.png'}

Meaning: An infix attached to the stem of an adjective い to indicate something that one cannot objectively measure on any scale (e.g. human emotion).
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn infix attached to the stem of an adjective い to indicate something that one cannot objectively measure on any scale (e.g. human emotion).', 'Example Sentences': [], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic-し.png'}

Meaning: A particle which marks an element X when nothing but X makes the expressed proposition true.Nothing/nobody/no ~ but; only
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which marks an element X when nothing but X makes the expressed proposition true.Nothing/nobody/no ~ but; only', 'Example Sentences': [('戸田さんしか煙草を吸わない・吸いません。', 'No one but Mr. Toda smokes.'), ('私は日本語しか知らない・知りません。', 'I know nothing but Japanese.'), ('それは江口さんにしか話していない・いません。', "I haven't told it to anybody but Mr. Eguchi."), ('私はご飯を一杯しか食べなかった・食べませんでした。', 'I had only one bowl of rice.'), ('パーティーには学生しか来なかった。', 'Only students came to the party.'), ('田村さんはサラダしか食べなかった。', 'Mr. Tamura ate only salad.'), ('私は日曜日（に）しか来られません。', 'I can come only on Sunday.'), ('この本はこの図書館（に）しかありません。', 'Only this library has this book.'), ('そこは車でしか行けない。', 'You can go there only by car. / The only way you can go there is by car.'), ('私は山田さんとしか話をしない。', 'I talk only with Mr. Yamada.'), ('この学校は学生が百人しかない。', 'This school has only a hundred students.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicしか.png'}

Meaning: An auxiliary verb which indicates the completion of an action.Have dome something; finish doing something; finish something up
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn auxiliary verb which indicates the completion of an action.Have dome something; finish doing something; finish something up', 'Example Sentences': [('池田君は三日でその本を読んでしまった・しまいました。', 'Mr. Ikeda finished reading the book in three days.'), ('私はルームメートのミルクを飲んでしまった・しまいました。', "I (mistakenly) drank my roommate's milk."), ('もう宿題をしてしまいましたか。', 'Have you done your homework yet?'), ('私は今日中にそのレポートを書いてしまおうと思っている。', 'I think that I will finish (writing) the report today.'), ('早くご飯を食べてしまいなさい。', 'Finish (eating) your meal quickly.'), ('シチューを作り過ぎてしまいました。', 'I made too much stew (to my regret).')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicしまう.png'}

Meaning: Someone gets information from some outside source.Get to know
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone gets information from some outside source.Get to know', 'Example Sentences': [('A:日本のことを知っていますか。\u2003\u2003B:はい、知っています。/いいえ、知りません。', "A: Do you know about Japan?\u2003\u2003B: Yes, I do. / No, I don't."), ('木下さんを知っていますか。', 'Do you know Mr. Kinoshita?'), ('山口さんの電話番号を知っていますか。', "Do you know Mr. Yamaguchi's telephone number?"), ('A:中国語を知っていますか。\u2003\u2003B:いいえ、知りません。', "A: Do you know Chinese?\u2003\u2003B: No, I don't."), ('私は上田さんがアメリカへ行ったことを知らなかった。', "I didn't know that Mr. Ueda had gone to America.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic知る.png'}

Meaning: An auxiliary which indicates that the information expressed by the preceding sentence is what the speaker heard.I hear that ~; I heard that ~; people say that ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn auxiliary which indicates that the information expressed by the preceding sentence is what the speaker heard.I hear that ~; I heard that ~; people say that ~', 'Example Sentences': [('山川さんがフランス語を勉強しているそうです。', 'I heard that Mr. Yamakawa is studying French.'), ('清水さんはお酒を飲まないそうです。', "I heard that Mr. Shimizu doesn't drink any alcohol."), ('日本の肉はとても高いそうだ。', 'I heard that meat in Japan is very expensive.'), ('利子さんは英語がとても上手だそうです。', 'I heard that Toshiko speaks very good English.'), ('キングさんは英語の先生だそうだ。', 'I heard that Mr. King is a teacher of English.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそうだ.png'}

Meaning: An auxiliary adjective which indicates that what is expressed by the preceding sentence is the speaker’s conjecture concerning an event in the future or the present state of someone or something, based on what the speaker sees or feels.Look; look like; appear; seem; feel like
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn auxiliary adjective which indicates that what is expressed by the preceding sentence is the speaker’s conjecture concerning an event in the future or the present state of someone or something, based on what the speaker sees or feels.Look; look like; appear; seem; feel like', 'Example Sentences': [('雨が降りそうだ・そうです。', 'It looks like it will rain.'), ('あの車が高そうだ・そうです。', 'That car looks expensive.'), ('この家は強い風が吹いたら倒れそうだ。', 'It looks like this house will fall down when a strong wind blows.'), ('あのステーキは美味しそうだった。', 'That steak looked delicious.'), ('この辺りは静かそうだ。', 'This neighbourhood looks quiet.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそうだ2.png'}

Meaning: A conjunction to indicate that what is stated in the preceding sentence is the reason or cause for what is stated in the following sentence.And; because of that; that is why; therefore; so
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA conjunction to indicate that what is stated in the preceding sentence is the reason or cause for what is stated in the following sentence.And; because of that; that is why; therefore; so', 'Example Sentences': [('昨日は風邪を引きました。それで学校を休んだんです。', "I had a cold yesterday. That's why I took a day off from school."), ('ちょっと大阪で用事がありました。それで昨日いなかったんです。', "I had some business in Osaka. That's why I wasn't here yesterday."), ('A:昨日はちょっと大阪で用事がありました。\u2003\u2003B:ああ、それでいらっしゃらなかったんですね。', "A: Yesterday I had to run an errand in Osaka.\u2003\u2003B: Oh, that why you weren't here."), ('A:昨日小川君とピンポンの試合をしたんだ。\u2003\u2003B:それで、先週新しいラケットを買ったんですね。', "A: Yesterday I played ping pong with Mr. Ogawa.\u2003\u2003B: That's why he bought a new paddle last week.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそれで.png'}

Meaning: If that is the caseIf so; then; well then
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesIf that is the caseIf so; then; well then', 'Example Sentences': [('A:このオレンジは甘くないです。\u2003\u2003B:それではこれはどう（ですか）。', 'A: This orange is not sweet.\u2003\u2003B: How about this one, then?'), ('A:僕は魚も肉も嫌いです。\u2003\u2003B:それでは何を食べるんですか。', 'A: I hate both fish and meat.\u2003\u2003B: Then, what do you eat.'), ('A:今日の午後テニスをしませんか。\u2003\u2003B:今日の午後はちょっと都合が悪いんですが。\xa0\xa0\xa0 A:それでは明日の午後はどうですか。', "A: Wouldn't you like to play tennis this afternoon?\u2003\u2003B: This afternoon is not convenient for me, but...\u2003\u2003A: Then, how about tomorrow afternoon?"), ('それでは二十分ぐらい休みましょう。', "Well then, let's take a break for about twenty minutes."), ('それではまた来週の金曜日に来ます。', "Well then, I'll come again next Friday.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそれでは.png'}

Meaning: A conjunction that indicates (1) temporally contiguous actions or states, or (2) a cumulative listing of objects, actions or states.After that; and then; in addition to that
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA conjunction that indicates (1) temporally contiguous actions or states, or (2) a cumulative listing of objects, actions or states.After that; and then; in addition to that', 'Example Sentences': [('昨日は二時間ぐらい友達と飲んでそれからうちに帰った・帰りました。', 'Yesterday I drank with my friend for about two hours and then went home.'), ('昨日は二時間ぐらい友達と飲んだ。それから本屋に寄ってうちに帰った。', 'Yesterday I drank with my friend for about two hours. Then I dropped by a bookstore and went home.'), ('十時まで宿題をしました。それから映画に行きました。', "I did my homework until 10 o'clock. And then, I went to the movie."), ('昨日は朝銀座に行って、それから映画を見に行った。', 'Yesterday morning I went to Ginza and then went to see a movie.'), ('レストランではステーキとサラダとそれからチーズケーキを食べました。', 'At the restaurant I ate steak, salad, and cheesecake.'), ('湖の色は初めは青く、それから緑になりました。', 'The colour of the lake was blue in the beginning and then turned green.'), ('月曜、火曜、それから木曜もとても忙しいです。', 'I am very busy on Monday, Tuesday, and Thursday, too.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそれから.png'}

Meaning: If that is the case,Then; in that case
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesIf that is the case,Then; in that case', 'Example Sentences': [('A:頭が痛いんです。\u2003\u2003B:それなら直ぐ寝なさい。', 'A: I have a headache.\u2003\u2003B: In that case, go to sleep right away.'), ('A:映画を見に行きませんか。\u2003\u2003B:明日試験があるんです。\u2003\u2003A:それなら、明後日はどうですか。', "A: Wouldn't you like to go see a movie?\u2003\u2003B: I have an exam tomorrow.\u2003\u2003A: Then, how about the day after tomorrow?"), ('A:日本にはどのぐらいいましたか。\u2003\u2003B:三年です。\u2003\u2003A:それなら、日本のことはよく知っているでしょうね。', 'A: How long did you stay in Japan?\u2003\u2003B: Three years.\xa0A: Then, you must know a lot about Japan.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそれなら.png'}

Meaning: A coordinate conjunction which connects two alternatives expressed by sentences.Or; either ~ or ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA coordinate conjunction which connects two alternatives expressed by sentences.Or; either ~ or ~', 'Example Sentences': [('この本が間違っているか（それとも）私が間違っているかどちらだ・です。', "It's either that this book is wrong or that I am wrong."), ('刺身を食べますか。それともすき焼きにしますか。', 'Will you have sashimi, or will you have sukiyaki?'), ('僕が来るか（それとも）村井さんが来るかどちらかです。', 'Either I will come or Mr. Murai will come.'), ('あの人は先生ですか。それとも医者ですか。', 'Is he a teacher or a doctor?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそれとも.png'}

Meaning: A coordinate conjunction that connects two sentences.And; and then
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA coordinate conjunction that connects two sentences.And; and then', 'Example Sentences': [('今日は東京に行った・行きました。そして友達に会った・会いました。', 'I went to Tokyo today. And I met my friend there.'), ('昨日は朝ゴルフをしました。そして午後はテニスをしました。', 'Yesterday I played golf in the morning. And I played tennis in the afternoon.'), ('この映画はつまらない。そして長過ぎる。', "This movie is uninteresting. And it's too long."), ('この花は奇麗です。そして安いです。', 'This flower is pretty. And it is inexpensive.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicそして.png'}

Meaning: Someone/something does something excessively or is in a state excessively.Too; do something too much/often; over-
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone/something does something excessively or is in a state excessively.Too; do something too much/often; over-', 'Example Sentences': [('ウィルソンは肉を食べ過ぎる・過ぎます。', 'Mr. Wilson eats too much meat.'), ('このアパートは私達には高過ぎる・過ぎます。', 'This apartment is too expensive for us.'), ('私は今朝寝過ぎて学校に遅れた。', 'I overslept this morning and was late for school.'), ('この机は私の部屋には大き過ぎる。', 'This desk is too big for my room.'), ('田中先生の授業は大変過ぎるので辞めました。', "I dropped Professor Tanaka's class because it was too demanding."), ('森さんは太り過ぎている。', 'Mr. Mori is too fat.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic過ぎる.png'}

Meaning: Something or someone is what someone likes.Like; be fond of
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomething or someone is what someone likes.Like; be fond of', 'Example Sentences': [('私はステーキが好きだ・好きです。', 'I like steak.'), ('僕は野球が好きだ。', 'I like baseball.'), ('ジョンソンさんはジャズが大好きです。', 'Mr. Johnson loves jazz.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic好きだ.png'}

Meaning: Small in number of quantity.Few; a small number of; little; a small quantity of ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSmall in number of quantity.Few; a small number of; little; a small quantity of ~', 'Example Sentences': [('この町はいいレストランが少ない・少ないです。', 'In this town good restaurants are few.'), ('この大学は女子学生が少ないです。', 'The number of female students at this college is small.'), ('日本は犯罪が少ない。', 'There are few crimes in Japan.'), ('日本語が書ける外国人は大変少ない。', 'Foreigners who can write Japanese are very few.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic少ない.png'}

Meaning: Someone/something causes a state or action to take place.Do; make; play; play the role of ~; wear
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone/something causes a state or action to take place.Do; make; play; play the role of ~; wear', 'Example Sentences': [('中山さんはテニスをする・します。', 'Mr. Nakayama plays tennis.'), ('リーズさんは英語の先生をしている・います。', 'Mr. Leeds is an English teacher.'), ('先生はテストを易しくした・しました。', 'The teacher made his test easy.'), ('木口は息子を医者にした・しました。', 'Kiguchi caused his son to become a physician.'), ('私は中国語を勉強している・います。', 'I am studying Chinese.'), ('京子は奇麗なスカーフをしている・います。', 'Kyoko is wearing a beautiful scarf.'), ('日本人は大抵土曜日も仕事をする。', 'The Japanese usually work on Saturdays, too.'), ('ビルはハムレットをするつもりだ。', 'Bill is going to play Hamlet.'), ('陽子は部屋を奇麗にした。', 'Yoko made her room clean.'), ('僕はよく車を運転します。', 'I often drive a car.'), ('一男はアメリカ人を妻にした。', 'Kazuo made a wife of an American.'), ('いいネクタイをしているね。', 'You’re wearing a nice tie, aren’t you?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicする.png'}

Meaning: Someone or something has some (semi)permanent attribute.Have
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone or something has some (semi)permanent attribute.Have', 'Example Sentences': [('洋子は長い足をしている・います。', 'Yoko has long legs.'), ('一男は丈夫な体をしています。', 'Kazuo has a strong body.'), ('この机は丸い形をしている。', 'This table has a round shape.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicする2.png'}

Meaning: Something is perceived by someone’s non-visual senses.Fear; smell; hear
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomething is perceived by someone’s non-visual senses.Fear; smell; hear', 'Example Sentences': [('子供達の声がした・しました。', "I heard children's voices."), ('この魚は変な味がしますね。', "This fish tastes funny, doesn't it?"), ('この切れはざらざらしている。', 'This cloth feels rough.'), ('この花はいい匂いがする。', 'This flower smells good.'), ('私は寒気がします。', 'I feel a chill.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicする3.png'}

Meaning: A verb that indicates how much something costs or a duration of time.Cost; lapse
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA verb that indicates how much something costs or a duration of time.Cost; lapse', 'Example Sentences': [('この時計は十万円する・します。', 'This watch costs 100,000 yen.'), ('後一年したら大学を出る・出ます。', "In another year I'll graduate from college."), ('A:それはどのぐらいしましたか。\u2003\u2003B:二十五万円ぐらいしました。', 'A: About how much did it cost?\u2003\u2003B: It cost about 250,000 yen.'), ('もう少しすれば主人が帰ってまいります。', 'In a short time my husband will be here.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicする4.png'}

Meaning: A coordinate conjunction which connects two sentences (the second sentence either describes an event which takes place right after the event described in the first sentence or it expresses a logical guess related to the event in the first sentence.)Thereupon ~; then ~; and ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA coordinate conjunction which connects two sentences (the second sentence either describes an event which takes place right after the event described in the first sentence or it expresses a logical guess related to the event in the first sentence.)Thereupon ~; then ~; and ~', 'Example Sentences': [('ジョギングを始めました。するとご飯が美味しくなりました。', 'I began jogging. Then, I began to have a good appetite.'), ('A:今日は月曜日ですよ。\u2003\u2003B:するとあのデパートは休みですね。', "A: Today is Monday, you know.\u2003\u2003B: Then, that department store is closed, isn't it?"), ('私は自転車を買いました。すると弟も欲しがりました。', 'I bought a bike. Then, my younger brother wanted one, too.'), ('頭が痛かったのでアスピリンを飲みました。すると痛みがすぐ止まりました。', 'I took an aspirin because I had a headache. Then, the headache disappeared right away.'), ('A:息子は今高校三年です。\u2003\u2003B:すると、来年は大学受験ですね。', "A: My son is now a junior at high school.\u2003\u2003B: Then, he is going to take a college entrance examination next year, isn't he?")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicすると.png'}

Meaning: An auxiliary adjective which expresses a desire to do something.Want (to do something); would like (to do something)
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn auxiliary adjective which expresses a desire to do something.Want (to do something); would like (to do something)', 'Example Sentences': [('私は日本へ行きたい・たいです。', 'I want to go to Japan.'), ('僕は今ピザを・が食べたい・たいです。', 'I want to eat pizza now.'), ('鈴木さんはアメリカへ行きたがっている・います。', 'Mr. Suzuki is showing signs of wanting to go to America. / Mr. Suzuki wants to go to America.'), ('僕は冷たいビールを・が飲みたい。', 'I want to drink a cold beer.'), ('今日は何を・が食べたいですか。', 'What do you want to eat today?'), ('三木さんは車を買いたがっている。', 'Mr. Miki wants to buy a car.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicたい.png'}

Word: 堪らない・たまらない
Meaning: The speaker or whomever he empathises with cannot cope with a situation expressed by the て phrase.Unbearably ~; extremely; be dying to do ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesThe speaker or whomever he empathises with cannot cope with a situation expressed by the て phrase.Unbearably ~; extremely; be dying to do ~', 'Example Sentences': [('今日は暑くて堪らない・堪りません。', 'It is unbearably hot today.'), ('数学が嫌いで堪らない・堪りません。', 'I really hate math.'), ('この本は面白くて堪りません。', 'This book is extremely interesting.'), ('父が死んで、悲しくて堪りません。', "My father died and I'm awfully sad."), ('美味しい魚が食べたくて堪りません。', "I'm dying to eat some good fish."), ('僕はあの子が好きで堪らない。', 'I just love that girl.'), ('兄は田中先生の授業が嫌で堪らなかった。', "My older brother really hated Mr. Tanaka's class.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic堪らない.png'}

Meaning: A noun that indicates a benefit, a purpose, a reason or a cause.On account of ~; for the benefit of ~; for the good of ~; for the sake of ~; on behalf of ~; for the purpose of ~; in order to ~; because of ~; owing to ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA noun that indicates a benefit, a purpose, a reason or a cause.On account of ~; for the benefit of ~; for the good of ~; for the sake of ~; on behalf of ~; for the purpose of ~; in order to ~; because of ~; owing to ~', 'Example Sentences': [('学生は試験のために勉強する・勉強します。', 'Students study in preparation for exams. / Students study because there are exams.'), ('私は日本のことを知るため（に）日本へ行く・行きます。', "I'll go to Japan (in order) to learn about Japan."), ('今年は雪があまり降らないため（に）スキーが出来ない・出来ません。', "Because it doesn't snow very much this year, we can't ski."), ('外国人のためのいい辞書がない・ありません。', "There aren't (any) good dictionaries for foreigners."), ('日本人は会社のためによく働きます。', 'The Japanese work hard for the sake of their company.'), ('雪のため（に）学校が休みになった。', 'The school was closed because of the snow.'), ('ジャクソンさんは研究のため（に）ドイツに行った。', 'Mr. Jackson went to Germany for the purpose of research.'), ('私は父が死んだため（に）大学に行けなかった。', "I couldn't go to college because my father died."), ('体を強くするため（に）毎日プールで泳いでいる。', "I'm swimming every day in the pool in order to strengthen my body."), ('親が甘かったため（に）子供が駄目になった。', 'Because the parents were soft, the children got spoiled.'), ('字が下手なため（に）人に笑われた。', 'I was laughed at because my handwriting is so poor.'), ('フランスに行ったのは香水を買うためだ。', 'It was for the purpose of buying perfume that I went to France.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic為に.png'}

Meaning: A subordinate conjunction which indicates that the action/state expressed by the main clause in a sentence takes place after the action/state expressed by the subordinate clause.If; when; after
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA subordinate conjunction which indicates that the action/state expressed by the main clause in a sentence takes place after the action/state expressed by the subordinate clause.If; when; after', 'Example Sentences': [('山田さんが来たら私は帰る・帰ります。', "When/If Mr. Yamada comes, I'll go home."), ('先生に聞いたら直ぐ分かった。', 'When I asked my teacher, I understood right away.'), ('私は大学を出たら小学校の先生になります。', "I'll be an elementary school teacher after graduating from college."), ('私は忙しいですから、面白かったら読みますが、面白くなかったら読みませんよ。', "I'm busy, so I'll read it if it's interesting, but I won't if it's not interesting."), ('嫌いだったら残して下さい。', "If you don't like it, please leave it."), ('英語だったら分かると思います。', "I think I'll understand it if it's English.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicたら.png'}

Meaning: A phrase which expresses a suggestion (literally: How would you feel if you do something?)Why don't you do ~?; what about doing ~?
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': "Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase which expresses a suggestion (literally: How would you feel if you do something?)Why don't you do ~?; what about doing ~?", 'Example Sentences': [('もっと日本の本を読んだらどうですか。', "Why don't you read more Japanese books?"), ('サラダも食べたらどうですか。', "Why don't you eat salad, too?"), ('山村先生に聞いたらどうですか。', "Why don't you ask Professor Yamamura?")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicたらどうですか.png'}

Meaning: A phrase which expresses an inexhaustive listing of action or states.Do things like ~ and ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase which expresses an inexhaustive listing of action or states.Do things like ~ and ~; sometimes ~ and sometimes ~', 'Example Sentences': [('私達は歌ったり躍ったりした・しました。', 'We did things like singing and dancing.'), ('このレストランのステーキは大きかったり小さかったりする・します。', 'Steaks at this restaurant are sometimes big and sometimes small.'), ('A:毎日テープを聞いていますか。\u2003\u2003B:いいえ、聞いたり聞かなかったりです。', "A: Are you listening to tapes every day?\u2003\u2003B: No, I listen at one time and don't listen at another (only off and on)."), ('私はニューヨークでミュージカルを見たりコンサートを聞いたりした。', 'In New York I did things like seeing musicals and listening to concerts.'), ('トムは来たり来なかったりする。', "Tom comes at one time and doesn't at another time (Tom doesn’t always come)."), ('明日は雨が降ったり止んだりするでしょう。', 'It will probably rain off and on tomorrow.'), ('この店の魚は新しかったり古かったりする。', "This shop's fish is sometimes fresh and sometimes old."), ('日本語の先生は日本人だったりアメリカ人だったりします。', 'Teachers of Japanese are sometimes Japanese and sometimes American.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicたり～たりする.png'}

Meaning: Even if someone did something or something were in some state (the desired result would not come about) or even if someone or something is in some state.Even if ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesEven if someone did something or something were in some state (the desired result would not come about) or even if someone or something is in some state.Even if ~', 'Example Sentences': [('あの人には話したって分からない・分かりません。', "Even if I tell him that, he won't understand it."), ('僕はその切符を高くたって買う・買います。', 'I will buy the ticket even if it is expensive.'), ('お金があったって車は買いたくない。', "Even if I had money, I wouldn't want to buy a car."), ('本を買ったって、忙しくて読めない。', "Even if I buy books, I'm too busy to read them."), ('汚くたって構いません。', "I don't care even if it is dirty."), ('遠くて不便だってマイ・ホームなら構いません。', "Even if it is far away and inconvenient, it doesn't matter if it is 'my home'."), ('どんなにいい先生だって時々間違います。', 'No matter how good a teacher may be, he sometimes makes mistakes.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicたって.png'}

Meaning: The て form ending of verbs and い-type adjectives (The て form ending of な-type adjectives and the て form of the copula is で.)And; -ing
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesThe て form ending of verbs and い-type adjectives (The て form ending of な-type adjectives and the て form of the copula is で.)And; -ing', 'Example Sentences': [('ジムは日本へ行って勉強した・勉強しました。', 'Jim went to Japan and studied (there).'), ('ここのステーキは安くて美味しい・美味しいです。', 'Steaks here are inexpensive and delicious.'), ('このアパートは静かでいい・いいです。', 'This apartment is quiet and good.'), ('私の父は先生で高校で英語を教えている・います。', 'My father is a teacher and teaches English at senior high school.'), ('私はコートを脱いでハンガーにかけた。', 'Taking off my coat, I hung it on a hanger.'), ('ワインを飲み過ぎて頭が痛い。', "I've drunk too much wine and have a headache."), ('私の部屋は狭くて暗い。', 'My room is small and dark.'), ('このスープは辛くて飲めない。', "This soup is salty (or (spicy) hot) and I can't drink it."), ('私はテニスが大好きでよく友達とする。', 'I love tennis and often play with my friends.'), ('ゆみ子は今大学三年で専攻は日本文学です。', 'Yumiko is a junior at college now and her major is Japanese literature.'), ('伊藤先生は今週病気で、かわりに村田先生が教えた。', 'Professor Itou was ill this week and Professor Murata taught for him.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicて.png'}

Meaning: ても is used when that which is expressed in the main clause is not what is expected from the content of the dependent (ても) clause.Even if; although
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesても is used when that which is expressed in the main clause is not what is expected from the content of the dependent (ても) clause.Even if; although', 'Example Sentences': [('私は雨が降っても行く・行きます。', "I'll go there even if it rains."), ('私は寒くても出かける・出かけます。', "I'll go out even if it is cold."), ('僕がトムでも同じことをしただろう・でしょう。', 'Even if I were Tom, I would probably have done the same thing.'), ('中山さんは本を買っても読みません。', "Mr. Nakayama doesn't read books even if he buys them."), ('私は四時間歩いても疲れなかった。', "I didn't get tired although I walked for four hours."), ('何を食べても美味しいです。', 'No matter what I eat, it tastes good.'), ('誰に聞いても分からなかった。', "No matter who I asked, I couldn't get the answer."), ('A:煙草を吸ってもいいですか。\u2003\u2003B:はい、いいです。', 'A: May I smoke?\u2003\u2003B: Yes, you may.'), ('どんなに日本語が難しくてもやってみます。', 'No matter how difficult Japanese may be, I will try it.'), ('どんなに丈夫でも体には気をつけた方がいい。', 'No matter how healthy you are, you’d better take good care of yourself.'), ('井上さんが先輩でも僕ははっきり言うつもりだ。', 'I intend to speak straightforwardly, even if Mr. Inoue is my senior.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicても.png'}

Meaning: A phrase which expresses persmission or concession.May; It is all right if
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase which expresses persmission or concession.May; It is all right if', 'Example Sentences': [('A:ここで煙草を吸ってもいいですか。\u2003\u2003B:はい、いいです。', 'A: May I smoke here?\u2003\u2003B: Yes, you may.'), ('高くてもいい・いいです。', "It is all right if it's expensive."), ('学生でもいい・いいです。', 'It is all right if you are a student.'), ('この椅子を使ってもいいですか。', 'May I used this chair?'), ('今日の宿題は作文です。短くてもいいですが面白いのを書いて下さい。', "Today's homework assignment is a composition. It is all right if it's short, but please write an interesting one."), ('A:テニスをしませんか。\u2003\u2003B:下手でもいいですか。', "A: Wouldn't you like to play tennis?\u2003\u2003B: Is it alright if I'm poor at it?"), ('A:何か冷たいものを飲みたいんですが。\u2003\u2003B:ビールでもいいですか。', 'A: I want to drink something cold.\u2003\u2003B: Will beer do?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicてもいい.png'}

Meaning: A particle which lists things exhaustively.And
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which lists things exhaustively.And', 'Example Sentences': [('マイクとディック（と）は学生だ・です。', 'Mike and Dick are students.'), ('私は英語と日本語を話す。', 'I speak English and Japanese.'), ('ミルズさんは来年ドイツとフランスとスペインへ行くつもりだ。', 'Mr. Mills is planning to go to Germany, France and Spain next year.'), ('ステーキはナイフとフォークで食べる。', 'We eat steak with a knife and fork.'), ('山本さんとスミスさんがテニスをしている。', 'Mr. Yamamoto and Mr. Smith are playing tennis.'), ('日本語とトルコ語は似ている。', 'Japanese and Turkish are alike.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicと.png'}

Meaning: A particle marking the noun phrase which maintains a reciprocal relationship with the subject of a clause.With; as; from
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle marking the noun phrase which maintains a reciprocal relationship with the subject of a clause.With; as; from', 'Example Sentences': [('私はアンディーと一緒にパーティーに行った・行きました。', 'I went to a party (together) with Andy.'), ('トムはジョンとよくテニスをする。', 'Tom often plays tennis with John.'), ('一郎はみどりと結婚した。', 'Ichiro married Midori.'), ('この車は僕の車と同じです。', 'This car is the same as my car.'), ('日本のきゅうりはアメリカのきゅうりと少し違います。', 'Japanese cucumbers are a little different from American ones.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicと2.png'}

Meaning: A particle which marks a quotation, sound or the manner in which someone/something does something.That; with the sound of; in the manner of
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which marks a quotation, sound or the manner in which someone/something does something.That; with the sound of; in the manner of', 'Example Sentences': [('ヒルさんは私に日本語で「こんにちは。」と言った・言いました。', 'Mr. Hill said to me in Japanese, “Hello!”'), ('トムは日本へ行きたいと言っている。', 'Tom says that he wants to go to Japan.'), ('これは十六世紀に建てられたと書いてあります。', 'It is written that this was built in the sixteenth century.'), ('私はバスで行こうと思う。', 'I think I will go by bus.'), ('子供達はバタバタと走れ回った。', 'The children ran around with a clattering noise.'), ('真知子はしっかりと私の手を握った。', 'Machiko grabbed my hand firmly.'), ('ベンはむっつりと座っている。', 'Ben is sitting sullenly.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicと3.png'}

Meaning: A subordinate conjunction which marks a condition that brings about an uncontrollable event or state.If; when
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA subordinate conjunction which marks a condition that brings about an uncontrollable event or state.If; when', 'Example Sentences': [('ニューヨークに行くと面白い店が沢山ある・あります。', 'If you go to New York, there are many interesting shops.'), ('それは先生に聞くとすぐ分かった。', 'I understood it immediately when I asked my teacher.'), ('タイヤは古いと危ないですよ。', 'Tires are dangerous if they are old.'), ('魚が嫌いだと日本へ行った時困りますか？', "If you don't like fish, will you have trouble when you go to Japan?"), ('学生だと割引があります。', 'If you are a student, there is a discount.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicと4.png'}

Meaning: An expression which presents as the topic of a following discourse a phrase which has just been uttered.Speaking of ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn expression which presents as the topic of a following discourse a phrase which has just been uttered.Speaking of ~', 'Example Sentences': [('A:この本は田中さんに借りたんです。\u2003\u2003B:田中さんと言えばもう病気は治ったのかしら。', "A: I borrowed this book from Mr. Tanaka.\u2003\u2003B: Speaking of Mr. Tanaka, I wonder if he's gotten over his illness yet."), ('A:次の日曜日は京都へ行くつもりだ。\u2003\u2003B:京都と言えば、春子が京都大学の入学試験に通ったそうだ。', "A: I'm going to Kyoto next Sunday.\u2003\u2003B: Speaking of Kyoto, I heard that Haruko passed Kyoto University's entrance exam."), ('A:小西君はよく休むね。\u2003\u2003B:よく休むと言えば、山本君も最近見ませんね。', "A: Mr. Konishi is absent frequently, isn't he?\u2003\u2003B: Talking about about (someone's) frequent absences, we don't see Mr. Yamamoto these days either, do we?")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicと言えば.png'}

Meaning: A phrase marking information which identifies or explains the noun following the phrase.Called; that says ~; that
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase marking information which identifies or explains the noun following the phrase.Called; that says ~; that', 'Example Sentences': [('「雪国」という小説を読んだ・読みました。', 'I read a novel called Snow Country.'), ('山田さんが入院したという知らせを聞いた・聞きました。', 'I heard the news that Mr. Yamada has been hospitalised.'), ('もっと頑張らなくては（ならない）という気持ちがある・あります。', 'I have the feeling that I have to keep hanging in there.'), ('「七人の侍」という映画を見たことがありますか。', 'Have you ever seen the film called Seven Samurai?'), ('ジューンが日本へ行くという話は本当ですか。', 'Is the story that June is going to Japan true?'), ('その人に会いたくないという気持ちはよく分かります。', "I am well aware of your feeling that you don't want to see him."), ('友達が今日来るということをすっかり忘れていた。', 'I completely forgot the fact that my friend is coming today.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicという.png'}

Meaning: A conjunction that lists two or more items, actions or states as inexhaustive examples.And; or
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA conjunction that lists two or more items, actions or states as inexhaustive examples.And; or', 'Example Sentences': [('私はバッハとかモーツアルトとかベートーベンが好きだ・好きです。', 'I like Bach, Mozart and Beethoven, among others.'), ('疲れた時はお風呂に入るとか早く寝るとかしなさい。', 'When you are tired, do things like taking a bath or going to sleep early.'), ('日本の茶道とか生け花とかいうものをよく知らない。', "I don't know much about things like the Japanese tea ceremony and flower arranging."), ('A:どんな日本の映画を見ましたか。\u2003\u2003B:黒沢の「七人の侍」とか「生きる」とか「影武者」を見ました。', "A: What kind of Japanese movie did you see?\u2003\u2003B: I saw Kurosawa's Seven Samurai, Ikiru and Kagemusha."), ('A:日曜日にはどんなことをしていますか。\u2003\u2003B:音楽を聞くとか、本を読むとかしています。', 'A: What sorts of things do you do on Sundays?\u2003\u2003B: I do things like listening to music or reading books.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicとか.png'}

Meaning: A dependent noun which indicates the time when someone/something will do/does/did something or the time when someone/something will be/is/was in some state.At the time when; when
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA dependent noun which indicates the time when someone/something will do/does/did something or the time when someone/something will be/is/was in some state.At the time when; when', 'Example Sentences': [('私は日本にいた時（に）お茶を習った・習いました。', 'I learned the tea ceremony when I was in Japan.'), ('ひろしは試験の時（に）風邪を引いた・引きました。', 'Hiroshi caught a cold at the exam time.'), ('松本さんは朝ご飯を食べる時いつもテレビを見る。', 'Mr. Matsumoto always watches TV when he eats his breakfast.'), ('テリーはジュースが安い時に沢山買っておいた。', 'Terry bought a lot of juice when it was cheap.'), ('僕は静かな時しか本を読まない。', "I read only when it's quiet."), ('私が大学生だった時妹はまだ三つだった。', 'When I was a college student, my sister was only three.'), ('これは出発の時に渡します。', "I'll give this to you at the time of your departure.")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basic時.png'}

Meaning: A place is in a location which takes a certain amount of time to get to.~ is (in) a place where it takes ~ to get to
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA place is in a location which takes a certain amount of time to get to.~ is (in) a place where it takes ~ to get to', 'Example Sentences': [('私のうちは駅から歩いて十分のところだ・です。', 'My house is in a place where it takes ten minutes to get to from the station on foot. / On foot my house is ten minutes from the station.'), ('学校はうちからバスで三十分のところです。', 'My school is in a place where it takes thirty minutes to get to from home by bus. / By bus it takes thirty minutes to get from home to school.'), ('その病院はここから車で十五分のところだ。', 'The hospital is in a place where it takes fifteen minutes to get to from here by car. / By car the hospital is fifteen minutes from here.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicところだ.png'}

Meaning: Someone/something is in the state where he/it is just about to do something, is doing something, has done something, or has been doing something.Be just about to do something; be in the midst of doing something; have just done something; have been doing something; almost did something
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone/something is in the state where he/it is just about to do something, is doing something, has done something, or has been doing something.Be just about to do something; be in the midst of doing something; have just done something; have been doing something; almost did something', 'Example Sentences': [('春江は晩ご飯を食べるところだ・です。', 'Harue is just about to eat her supper.'), ('春江は晩ご飯を食べているところだ・です。', 'Harue is in the midst of eating her supper.'), ('春江は晩ご飯を食べたところだ・です。', 'Harue has just eaten her supper.'), ('春江は晩ご飯を食べていたところだ・です。', 'Harue has been eating her supper.'), ('私はもう少しで宿題を忘れるところだった・でした。', 'I almost forgot (was about to forget) my homework.'), ('私は危ないところをジーンに助けてもらった・もらいました。', 'I was saved by Gene was I was in a crisis (literally: dangerous state).'), ('お仕事中のところをすみません。', "I'm sorry to bother you in the midst of your work."), ('僕は今出かけるところです。', "I'm just about to go out now."), ('テリーと踊っているところをマーサに見られてしまった。', 'The state in which I was dancing with Terry was seen by Martha. / Martha saw me when I was dancing with Terry.'), ('ご飯を食べ終わったところにまり子が訪ねて来た。', 'Mariko came (to see me) at the state in which I had just finished my meal. / Mariko came to see me when I’d just finished my meal.'), ('三章まで読んだところで寝てしまった。', 'I fell asleep when I had read up to the third chapter (literally: in the state in which I had read it up to the third chapter).'), ('私は危なく溺れるところだった。', 'I was almost drowned.'), ('お忙しいところをどうもありがとうございました。', 'Thank you very much (for helping me) in the state when you are busy. / Thank you very much for sparing your precious time with me.'), ('利男は一番大事なところでよく勉強しなかったから何も分からなくなってしまった。', 'Toshio has come to the point of not understanding anything because he didn’t study well in the state where (the class) was the most important. / Toshio has gotten totally lost because he didn’t study hard when it was most important.'), ('お休みのところをすみません。', 'I’m sorry (to disturb) the state in which you are off duty. / I’m sorry to bother you when you are off duty/on vacation.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicところだ2.png'}

Meaning: A compound particle which indicates the capacity, role or function of someone or something.As; in the capacity of
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA compound particle which indicates the capacity, role or function of someone or something.As; in the capacity of', 'Example Sentences': [('田中さんはセールスマンとして採用された・されました。', 'Mr. Tanaka was hired as a salesman.'), ('私は医者としてあなたに言います。', "I'll tell you (this) as a doctor."), ('木村さんとは友達として付き合っているだけです。', "I'm just keeping company with Mr. Kimura as a friend."), ('この部屋は物置として使っている。', "I'm using this room as a storeroom.")], 'Image Notes': None}

Meaning: A compound particle which indicates a standard for comparisons.For
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA compound particle which indicates a standard for comparisons.For', 'Example Sentences': [('このステーキは日本のステーキとしては安い・安いです。', 'This steak is inexpensive for Japanese steak.'), ('ジョンソンさんは日本語の一年生としては日本語が上手だ。', 'Mr. Johnson is good at Japanese for a first-year student (of Japanese).'), ('これは日本のアパートとしては大きい方です。', 'For a Japanese apartment, this is one of the bigger ones.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicとしては.png'}

Meaning: An intention or conviction of a speaker (or a person with whom the speaker can empathise) about his future or past actions or current state.Intend to ~; be convinced that ~; believe; feel sure that ~; be going to; mean
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesAn intention or conviction of a speaker (or a person with whom the speaker can empathise) about his future or past actions or current state.Intend to ~; be convinced that ~; believe; feel sure that ~; be going to; mean', 'Example Sentences': [('私は来年結婚するつもりだ・です。', 'I intend to get married next year.'), ('父はまだ若いつもりだ・です。', 'My father is convinced that he is still young.'), ('私はよく読んだつもりだ・です。', "I'm convinced that I read it carefully."), ('これはお礼のつもりだ・です。', 'This is my intention of appreciation.'), ('休みには何をするつもりですか。', 'What do you intend to do during the vacation?'), ('僕は大学に行くつもりはない。', 'I have no intention of going to college.'), ('あんな人にはもう会わないつもりです。', 'I do not intend to see that kind of person.'), ('私はまだ元気なつもりだ。', "I'm convinced that I'm still healthy."), ('話したつもりでしたが、話さなかったんですね。', "I thought I talked to you about it, but I didn't, did I?"), ('この仕事は遊びのつもりです。', 'This work is intended to be a pastime.'), ('それで勉強しているつもりですか。', 'Are you sure you can study like that?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicつもり.png'}

Meaning: A colloquial topic-introducer.Speaking of ~
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA colloquial topic-introducer.Speaking of ~', 'Example Sentences': [('アメリカ人ってフットボールが好きだ・好きですね。', "Speaking of Americans, they love football, don't they?"), ('漢字を覚えるって大変だ・大変ですね。', "To memorize kanji, it's terribly hard, isn't it?"), ('漢字って面白いですよ。', 'Speaking of kanji, they are interesting, I tell you.'), ('日本人ってよく写真を撮りますね。', "Speaking of Japanese people, they love taking pictures, don't they?"), ('外国で暮らすって難しいね。', "Living in a foreign country is hard, isn't it?"), ('木が多いっていいものだね。', "It's good to have many trees, isn't it?"), ('家が広いっていいですね。', "It's good to have a spacious house, isn't it?")], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicって.png'}

Meaning: A colloquial quotation marker.That
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA colloquial quotation marker.That', 'Example Sentences': [('ジェーンは踊らないって。', "Jane said that she wouldn't dance / They say that Jane won't dance."), ('今晩は雪が降るって。', "They say it's going to snow tonight."), ('僕も行こうかって思いました。', 'I wondered if I should go there, too.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicって2.png'}

Meaning: During a period when a certain situation remains in effect.While; before; during
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesDuring a period when a certain situation remains in effect.While; before; during', 'Example Sentences': [('前田さんはアメリカにいるうちに英語が上手なった・なりました。', "Mr. Maeda's English improved while he was in America."), ('何もしないうちに今年も終わった・終わりました。', "Before I've achieved anything, this year is over."), ('走っているうちにお腹が痛くなった・なりました。', 'My stomach started to ache while I was running.'), ('若いうちに本を沢山読みなさい。', "Read many books while you're young."), ('雨が降らないうちにテニスをして来ます。', "I'll go and play tennis (and come back) before it rains."), ('忘れないうちに言っておきたいことがある。', 'There is something I want to tell you before I forget.'), ('考えているうちに分からなくなった。', 'While thinking about it, I got lost.'), ('働けるうちに出来るだけ働きたい。', "I'd like to work as much as possible while I can work."), ('温かいうちに飲んで下さい。', 'Please drink it while it is warm.'), ('休みのうちによく寝ておきます。', 'I’ll sleep a lot during the vacation.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicうちに.png'}

Meaning: A particle which marks a topic or a contrastive element.Talking about ~; as for ~; the
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA particle which marks a topic or a contrastive element.Talking about ~; as for ~; the', 'Example Sentences': [('私は学生だ・です。', 'I am a student.'), ('杉田さんは行きますが私は行きません。', "Mr. Sugita will go (there) but I won't go."), ('ジョーンズさんは今日本語を勉強している。', 'Mr. Jones is studying Japanese now.'), ('この町には大学が二つある。', 'There are two universities in this town.'), ('私はビールは飲みますが酒は飲みません。', "I drink beer but don't drink sake."), ('春子には人形を、秋子には絵本をあげた。', 'I gave Haruko a doll and Akiko a picture book.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicは.png'}

Meaning: A sentence final particle used in weak assertive or volitional sentences by a female speaker.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA sentence final particle used in weak assertive or volitional sentences by a female speaker.', 'Example Sentences': [('私も明日のパーティーに行くわ。', "I'll go to tomorrow's party, too."), ('大木さんはもう帰りましたわ。', 'Mr. Ooki has already gone home.'), ('久子はまだ学生ですわ。', 'Hisako is still a student.'), ('この部屋は小さいわ。', 'This room is small.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicわ.png'}

Meaning: Someone or something is/was someone or something or is/was in some state, or will do/does/did something.
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesSomeone or something is/was someone or something or is/was in some state, or will do/does/did something.', 'Example Sentences': [('これは本だ・です。', 'This is a book.'), ('コンサートは八時からだ・です。', "The concert is from eight o'clock."), ('あの人は先生だ。', 'That person is a teacher.'), ('私はジョーンズです。', 'I am Jones.'), ('授業は四時までです。', "My classes are till four o'clock."), ('今度の試合はワシントン大学とだ。', 'The next game is against the University of Washington.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicは～だ.png'}

Meaning: A construction which relates a non-controllable state of something or someone to a topic
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA construction which relates a non-controllable state of something or someone to a topic', 'Example Sentences': [('私は英語が分かる・分かります。', 'To me, English is understandable.'), ('花子は目が奇麗だ・奇麗です。', 'Speaking of Hanako, her eyes are pretty.'), ('辞書はウェブスターがいい・いいです。', "Talking about dictionaries, Webster's is good."), ('たかしはテニスが上手だ。', 'Takashi is good at tennis.'), ('私はボーイフレンドが欲しい。', 'I want a boyfriend.'), ('僕はフットボールが好きだ。', 'I like football.'), ('象は鼻が長い。', 'Elephants have long trunks.'), ('私はお腹が空いた。', 'I am hungry.'), ('ミラーさんは背が高い。', 'Mr. Miller is tall.'), ('日本はステーキが高い。', 'Steak is expensive in Japan.'), ('海は日本海が奇麗だ。', 'Talking about the sea, the Japan Sea is clean.'), ('日本の野球はどこが強いですか。', 'Talking about baseball in Japan, who is strong?')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicは～が.png'}

Meaning: A phrase which indicates prohibition.Cannot do something; must not do something; don’t do something; should not do something
Detailed Info: {'Explanation': 'Spoiler English example sentencesA phrase which indicates prohibition.Cannot do something; must not do something; don’t do something; should not do something', 'Example Sentences': [('この部屋に入ってはいけない・いけません。', 'You must not enter this room.'), ('教室でものを食べてはいけません。', 'You must not eat (food) in the classroom.'), ('花子はまだ酒を飲んではいけない。', 'Hanako must/can not drink alcohol yet.')], 'Image Notes': 'https://postautistic.github.io/img/Basicはいけない.png'}

Meaning: Can figure out (spontaneously) various facts –such as content, nature, value, meaning, cause, reason, result– about something whose existence is presupposed.Be comprehensible; understand; can tell; figure out
